text.content: Click a Lesson or Activity to learn more about What Parents Can Do.

As children of all ages learn through exploration, it is critical that parents remain patient and provide a safe environment. Creating a safe and nurturing environment is the best way to foster a child's natural curiosity and desire to explore.

Key Messages:
  • Children are at a variety of development stages in terms of understanding how to stay safe.
  • Children need adults and caregivers to make their environments safe.
  • Adults can encourage their children's curiosity.

graphic.notes: #140 Physical Master 2 yrs. Gabriella - 123-45 from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition
Matt and Madison with watch from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition
#208 4 yrs. Sam - 59-53 from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition

audio.transcript: As children of all ages learn through exploration, it is critical that parents remain patient and provide a safe environment. Creating a safe and nurturing environment is the best way to foster a child's natural curiosity and desire to explore.

For example, research tells us that a parent's reaction to a baby's explorations will help determine whether or not he or she will continue a particular activity. Remind parents that they can create a nurturing environment for exploration by using their facial expressions and body movements in order to show their baby how they feel. They can show their baby that they are excited or impatient, and they can warn their baby about danger.

In this topic, the Key Messages are that children are at a variety of developmental stages in terms of understanding how to stay safe. They need adults and caregivers to make their environments safe. In this way, adults can encourage their children's curiosity.

text.content:
A child's exploration of his or her world can be challenging for many parents. As you present these tips, remind parents that some frustration is normal. It is not uncommon for parents to feel that their children's "testing" is hard to deal withâ€”it can be.

The purpose of this workshop is to help parents realize that exploration is a key component of development and that with consistent and nurturing care from parents, children will learn and thrive.
